official-title.#text:
To establish the Law School Clinic Certification Program of the United States Patent and Trademark
			 Office, and for other purposes.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

header.#text: USPTO Law School Clinic Certification Program

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: United States Patent and Trademark Office

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, is
			 established as a program entitled the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: United States Patent and Trademark Office

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: (in this section referred to as the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Under Secretary of Commerce for Intellectual Property and Director of the United States
			 Patent and Trademark Office

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall be in effect for the 10-year period beginning
			 on the date of the enactment of this Act.

quote.#tail:
) may establish regulations and procedures for application to and participation in the program,
			 which shall be available to accredited law schools. The

text.#text: The Law School Clinic Certification Program of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall, not later than the last day of the 2-year period beginning on the date of the
			 enactment of this Act, submit to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Committees on the Judiciary of the
			 House of Representatives

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, describing the number of law schools and law
			 students participating in the program, the work done through the program,
			 the benefits of the program, and any recommendations of the

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 5108 IH: To establish the Law School Clinic Certification Program of the United States Patent and Trademark Office, and for other purposes.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}rights.#text: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
